SEARCH
Package com.csse3200.game.components.minigames.robotFighting

Class RobotFightingGame

java.lang.Object
com.csse3200.game.components.minigames.robotFighting.RobotFightingGame
public class RobotFightingGame extends Object
Core logic class for the "Clanker Royale" (Robot Fighting) minigame.

Handles setup, fight logic, UI toggling, encouragement mechanics, and winner determination. This class interacts closely with RobotFightingDisplay for visuals and user interactions.

Main responsibilities:

  • Initialises the minigame entity and UI display.
  • Controls when the game UI is shown or hidden via interact events.
  • Manages health values and combat timers between two fighters.
  • Tracks player encouragement level, which modifies damage output.
  • Determines the fight outcome and triggers UI updates.

The class registers to the following entity events:

  • interact — toggles the game screen open/close.
  • robotFighting:choose — selects a fighter robot.
  • robotFighting:startFight — begins the combat sequence.
  • robotFighting:encourage — applies an encouragement effect.

  • Constructor Details

    • RobotFightingGame

      public RobotFightingGame()
      Default constructor for production use.

      Loads encouragement text from games/robot-fighting.json and creates all required LibGDX components via InteractableStationFactory.

  • Method Details

    • initGameEntity

      protected Entity initGameEntity()
      Creates and initialises the entity and components for this minigame.

      Subclasses (e.g., in tests) can override this method to return a lightweight mock entity without requiring LibGDX assets.

      Returns:
      a new Entity configured for the Robot Fighting game.

    • getGameEntity

      public Entity getGameEntity()
      Returns the root Entity containing this minigame’s components.

      Used for event registration and testing.

      Returns:
      the game entity instance.
